item.title: 6 Best RPGs With Non-Combat Magic
item.description:
Summary

  • RPGs offer more than combat: magic is now used for exploration, diplomacy, and storytelling.
  • Games like Dread Delusion and Arx Fatalis show how spells can help avoid combat creatively.
  • Baldur's Gate 3 allows magic users to solve problems and shape encounters using utility spells.

Magic, with its infinite possibilities, has always been central to roleplaying games, but not all spells are meant for slaying monsters. While early tabletop and computer RPGs were shaped in the deadly combat of dungeon crawls, it didnâ€™t take long for players to look beyond the sword. As the genre matured, so did the possibilities of the magical arts. Spells became tools for exploration, diplomacy, survival, and storytelling. Players drawn to magic-users often sought more than firepower.

Inspired by peace-loving figures like Gandalf from The Lord of the Rings , they chose subtlety over strength, solving problems with charm, insight, and the occasional use of teleportation. Perhaps because the human imagination is infinite and words are more cost-effective than even the most efficient game developer's workflow, cRPGs often pigeonhole magic users into tertiary combat roles. However, these rare gems carry that tabletop legacy forward, demonstrating (expensive) out-of-the-box magic systems where combat is just one path among many.

6 Dread Delusion

Breaking The Physical Laws Of A World Long Since Shattered

Dread Delusion
8.0 /10
Released
June 15, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

The indie open-world Dread Delusion is already impressive for its presentation of a vast chain of floating islands, all built on an indie budget. With all the psychedelic mushrooms, retro low-fi graphics, and focus on non-linear exploration, it could be described as a PS1-era take on Morrowind . Dread Delusion takes on board some of the same game design philosophy in that it grants players access to a wide spectrum of spells to suit a variety of playstyles.

Many can be used to obliterate enemies, to be sure. However, spells like Entice, Fade, and Slow allow players to avoid combat encounters in a manner befitting a trickster magician. Other utility spells like Return Home and Agility's Addendum allow their casters to flatten the spore-infested space between the floating islands and whip around faster than a sky pirate's airship. Magic also has a part to play in opening secret entrances and finding hidden treasures only visible to the magically gifted.

5 Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines

Mind Tricks and Sanguine Sorcery

3 Images
3 Images
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines
Action RPG
Systems
Released
November 16, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

The central premise of Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines is that in order to survive, vampires must learn to live amongst the human population undiscovered. Many of the spells, or Disciplines, revolve around the subtle manipulation of the world and others in order to maintain this cover.

The player's magical abilities vary depending on their sire's heritage. Those born into the Ventrue clan can dominate the minds of others in dialogue. Malkavians can vanish from sight and see the world more clearly than most, but their reality warping comes at a cost to their sanity. Despite being turned into a bloodthirsty vampire, it is entirely possible for the player to use magic to bypass violence, charm, or slip by obstacles before a fight even begins.

4 Arx Fatalis

Breaking Free Through Magical Means

3 Images
3 Images
Arx Fatalis
RPG
Systems
Released
December 23, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

Arx Fatalis is undeniably janky by today's standards. AF 's borderline experimental mechanics and presentation can be off-putting at first, but once players become accustomed to the strange controls and sensitive first-person simulation elements, they will find a lot to love, especially when it comes to its magic spells, which the player initiates by drawing runes in the air.

Because the entire game takes place in an underground society of tunnels and caves, normally game-breaking abilities like Levitate and Telekinesis are up for grabs for the enterprising mage. Players can enchant objects, conjure force fields, raise the dead, and paralyze en masse to get up to all sorts of mischief, but their mastery over magic will allow them to see past illusions and break the enchantments of others.

3 Arcanum: Of Steamworks and Magick Obscura

Beyond Spellslinging Fireballs And Magic Missiles

3 Images
3 Images
Arcanum: of Steamworks and Magick Obscura
RPG
Adventure
Action
Systems
Released
September 26, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

There are few games as ambitious as Arcanum: Of Steamworks and Magick Obscura . Its size, depth, and build possibilities are staggering. While half of the game (the Steamworks part) focuses on technology, it has a suite of mechanics that should appeal to both the firebolt aficionados and lovers of magic for its rule-breaking and mystical aspects, as the Tolkien-meets-industrial revolution world was built with player agency and broad build viability in mind.

Spells from the Convayance, Phantasm, and Temporal schools can mess with the fabric of reality, allowing a mage to open locks with a finger snap, teleport through hard matter, or become invisible. The Nature and Mental schools give mages options when dealing with foes, wild or civilized, that do not require resorting to dismemberment or blast damage. The White Necrotic school even allows players to roleplay as a healer and cure the sick, assuming their patients are attuned to magic.

2 The Elder Scrolls Series

A Magical World Of Tricksters And Scholars (And Battlemages)

Skyrim
9.3 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes
Powered by

From breaking off from the main quest to pick flowers to sitting by a hearth to read the next thrilling chapter of "The Real Barenziah," The Elder Scrolls is known for providing players with activities that go beyond sword swinging and corpse-looting. A fantasy world that aims to give as much player agency as possible would, of course, feature magic that allows its caster to do more than hit obstacles head-on.

The Clever Craft in Skyrim , Oblivion , and Morrowind offers many magical means by which to traverse Nirn, interact with NPCs, and reach off-limit places. Spells like Invisibility, Calm, Feather, and Water Breathing allow players to bypass enemies. Communion with Daedra offers powers that can manipulate the weather and summon pack-mule servants. The most powerful magic users can even learn to fly (in Morrowind, at least).

1 Baldur's Gate 3

A Faithful Adaptation Even To Its Magical Roleplaying Potential

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
132
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Based on Dungeons & Dragons 5e, Baldurâ€™s Gate 3 has one of the most robust non-combat magic systems in modern RPGs. Every class gets access to useful non-combat utility spells, like Speak with Animals, Friends, Feather Fall, and Disguise Self, that dramatically change how situations unfold and can potentially unlock entire quest branches or unique dialogue options.

The gameâ€™s flexible approach to spellcasting means players can shape encounters before initiative is even rolled. Charm a guard, teleport to a ledge, detect a hidden illusion, or light a room with Dancing Lights; Baldurâ€™s Gate 3 invites mages to think like problem solvers, not just mystical blasters.

item.title: 8 Open-World Games With The Best Easter Eggs, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Saints Row 2's Easter eggs, like a giant Easter bunny rising from water, showcase the series' fun personality.
  • Assassin's Creed 2 includes scary and memorable Easter eggs, such as a massive squid and ghostly family members.
  • Batman: Arkham City's Easter eggs, like Calendar Man and Scarecrow references, enhance the game's rich history.

Easter eggs are a treat to find in any video game. It's always nice when developers let their personalities shine in games that they've put their hearts and souls into, and open-world games are no exception.

These Easter eggs give gamers yet another excuse to explore these virtual worlds to their heart's content and uncover everything they have to offer. From creepy inclusions to funny secrets, there's no shortage of fun Easter eggs to find in these open-world games.

8 Saints Row 2

Seeing An Easter Bunny Rising From The Water Is Hilarious

6 Images
6 Images
Saints Row 2
7.0 /10
Released
October 14, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Saints Row is a series known for not taking itself too seriously. While the first game couldn't shake off its label of being a GTA clone, the same can't be said for later titles in the series.

Saints Row 2 is when the franchise started developing a personality of its own, and this can be seen in the many fun Easter eggs players can find in this title. From a massive Easter bunny coming out of the water to the gravestones referencing celebrities and developers, the creative Easter eggs in Saints Row 2 easily prove to be unforgettable.

7 Assassin's Creed 2

Seeing A Massive Squid In The Water Is Terrifying

Assassin's Creed 2
13
9.0 /10
Released
November 7, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language
Powered by

Assassin's Creed 2 is one of the best video games ever made, thrusting Ezio into the limelight as one of the most memorable gaming protagonists around. This title is full of memorable story beats and some fun Easter eggs for players to discover, too.

The most infamous one of the lot is the giant squid in the Assassin Tomb beneath Santa Maria della Visitazione, which will swim past inquisitive players before trying to whack them with one of its tentacles. However, there is another Easter egg that is even more chilling: the ghosts of Ezio's family, who can be seen in his ruined house.

6 Batman: Arkham City

The Calendar Man And Scarecrow's Involvement In The Next Game Make For Great Easter Eggs

Batman Arkham City
9 /10
18
9.4 /10
Released
October 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Arkham City was a major step forward for the Batman series, with Rocksteady implementing a lauded sandbox and perfecting its combat, which everyone sang praises about. Given the rich history of the Caped Crusader, it's easy to see why the Easter eggs in this title feel all the more impactful.

Harley Quinn's failed pregnancy is the most chilling one, although Killer Croc's surprise appearance, Ra's al Ghul's disappearing body, and messages alluding to Scarecrow's presence as the main villain in Arkham Knight are also quite iconic.

5 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

A Game Full Of Iconic Easter Eggs

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
50
9.4 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

The Witcher 3 boasts one of the biggest open worlds that fans can see in a video game. So, it's easy to see why CD Projekt Red felt the need to load this game up with so many memorable Easter eggs.

The three farting troll YouTubers, a reference to Tyrion Lannister in the sky cells, the infamous murder rabbit from Monty Python and the Holy Grail , and a Dark Souls -esque bonfire in Blood & Wine are just a few of the many Easter eggs present in this beloved game.

4 Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

Gant Bridge Is Iconic, But There Are More Easter Eggs To Find Throughout The World

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
111
8.7 /10
Released
October 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Powered by

When people talk about Easter eggs in video games, it's only a matter of time before a Grand Theft Auto title is mentioned. Rockstar loves to set weird secrets for their players to find, and San Andreas is no exception to this.

The first thing that comes to mind here is Gant Bridge, which has a hilarious board that alludes to the meta details of this construction, coupled with a message telling players to go away if they reach the top. Along with this, there's also Madd Dogg poking fun at Driv3r and the graves near Catalina's house highlighting her turbulent past with men, to name a few.

3 Terraria

A Beloved Sandbox Full Of Unique Easter Eggs

Terraria
7 /10
17
9.4 /10
Released
May 16, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood and Gore, Cartoon Violence, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

There aren't many game developers that love and respect their fan bases as much as Terraria does. The sheer amount of updates for this game is mind-boggling, with some of this post-launch content adding a bunch of cheeky Easter eggs for players to find, too.

Some of the seeds that players can use have a bunch of unique effects to spice up a playthrough. Along with this, the game pays homage to Minecraft and Stardew Valley while also referencing some of the biggest elements of pop culture, such as Star Wars and The Legend of Zelda .

2 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

The Sheer Number Of Easter Eggs In This Title Is Mind-Boggling

Skyrim
9.3 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes
Powered by

Skyrim is one of the best open-world games ever made that fans can get lost in, with modding support ensuring that players can get invested in this title for hours on end. It also has its fair share of secrets that many fans will love discovering during their journey across the world of the Nords.

The Headless Horseman is one of the most notable Easter eggs that leads players to a location with tough draugr to fight. On top of that, a skeletal arm can be found holding up a sword in a pond northeast of Bleakwind Basin, which is a reference to the Lady of the Lake in The Legend of King Arthur .

1 Grand Theft Auto 4

The Heart Of Liberty City Is Shocking To Witness To This Day

Grand Theft Auto 4
22
9.1 /10
Released
April 29, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

To this day, the heart of Liberty City in Grand Theft Auto 4 is an Easter egg that will likely send chills up a player's spine when they first encounter it. Players who experimented enough to enter the interior of the Statue of Happiness were left very unsettled by this massive beating heart.

Along with this, other Easter eggs in GTA 4 reference everything from pop culture icons to Rockstar's games. The statue itself looks like Hillary Clinton holding a cup of coffee, which could very well be a reference to the infamous controversy that surrounded San Andreas back when it launched.

item.title: Dune Awakening: Best Transportation Build
item.description:
It's a big desert out there on Arrakis, and players need to use all their resources to survive and thrive in the harsh landscape. It's not just about moving fast in Dune: Awakening . Players also have to use surveying, cartography, and climbing when it comes to resource farming and exploration.

Each class in Dune: Awakening has access to the skills of other classes, and players can unlock the other classes through a series of quests to get access to all of them. The location of the trainers makes it easier and more efficient to find them and finish their quests in a certain order. Players who want to prioritize improving their transportation abilities should choose the following skills, techniques, and passive abilities.

Players generally start their adventure in the central southern area of the Hagga Basin, where they'll also build their first base. The Trooper is one of the most accessible trainers at this time, located in Griffin's Reach, followed by the Planetologist at Imperial Testing Station #2. The other three are located in the Vermillius Gap in the northern section of the map.

Start With Bene Gesserit Or Trooper

The Best Initial Classes

Each has skills that are useful for traveling from the first level, but for the best transportation build in Dune: Awakening , players should start with either the Bene Gesserit or the Trooper class during the initial character creation process. Unlocking the skill trees for one of these classes immediately grants the character abilities that can help make early desert travel and exploration that much easier.

It's up to the player which class they choose to start their adventure, but the Bene Gesserit is highly recommended due to the location of the Trainers. Players will visit Griffin's Tradepost as part of their initial quest chain, but Harko Village, where the Bene Gesserit trainer is waiting, which is in the Vermillius Gap, much farther north.

Bene Gesserit

The Bene Gesserit skill tree is divided into three branches. Of these, the Weirding Way and Body Control branches have the most to offer for aspiring survivalists and explorers.

  • Bindu Sprint: From the Weirding Way branch, this Ability allows the character to run forward with a burst of speed for several seconds, allowing for faster travel or a quick escape.
  • Sun Tolerance: From the second tier of the Body Control branch, this slows the negative effects of sun exposure, such as dehydration and sunstroke, when exploring or gathering.
  • Recovery: This is the root of Body Control, and it makes recovery faster if the character is critically injured.
  • Self-Healing: This third-level passive ability improves the benefits of any healing methods the character uses, such as healkits or bandages.

Trooper

The Suspensor Training and Gunnery branches give the Trooper some advantages when it comes to freedom of movement. Many of the skills they have related to crowd control and battlefield management are also handy when climbing or exploring.

  • Anti-Gravity Field: Creates a sphere that removes the effects of gravity on anything and anyone within. It can be used on enemies to limit their movements or in a strategic location to prevent falling damage if the player climbs too high.
  • Suspensor Dash: One tier above the Anti-Gravity Field, this technique allows the character to dash forward in midair.
  • Field Maintenance: More useful later in the game when the player has access to advanced tools and weapons, this reduces their durability loss, allowing the player to stay in the wilderness to forage and travel for longer periods.

Find The Planetologist

Unlock The Hidden Class

It's easy to find Imperial Testing Station #2 almost due east of Griffin's Reach. Speak to the lone resident, Derek Chinara, and he'll send the player on a fetch quest to find and return an important set of records lost in the ruins below. Complete them, and he'll unlock the Planetologist skill tree, which has some of the most ideal skills for observation, exploring, and repairing.

Planetologist

All three branches have something for gathering, discovery, and travel, with the Explorer and Mechanic branches proving to be the most beneficial.

  • Suspensor Pad: This ability from the Explorer branch is used to raise the player a few extra feet into the air, which is useful when surveying or traveling.
  • Mountaineer: This second-tier ability reduces the drain that climbing takes on Stamina, and can reach -25% at level 3.
  • Cartographer: Gives players the ability to make sinkcharts of the important locations in any given region, provided they have a blank one in their inventory.
  • Vehicle Repair: The first choice in the Mechanic branch gives players a reduction on their vehicle's maximum durability loss.
  • Fuel Efficient Driver: Improves the fuel efficiency of all ground vehicles for longer and more thorough exploration and resource-gathering expeditions.

The Swordmaster Skills

More Hydration, Better Survival

The Swordmaster trainer, Arno, can be found in Pinnacle Station in the Eastern Shield Wall region. He gives the player a series of quests that require an extensive amount of traveling, so hopefully the character has already opened up the previous skill trees or saved up for the ornithopter ride to reach him. The player should already have visited the Bene Gesserit, Planetologist, and Trooper trainers before seeking out the Swordmaster.

Swordmaster

The skills in the Swordmaster trees that make transportation and survival easier overlap into combat skills and are found in The Way branch.

  • Optimized Hydration: One tier up in The Way skill branch, this skill gives the character more stamina provided they remain well hydrated, which helps with climbing and sprinting.
  • Field Medicine: This passive ability improves the beneficial effects of healkits by 10, 15, and eventually 20%, which is great for travel and combat.
  • Disciplined Breathing: A third-tier Technique that improves the character's Stamina recovery rate, also from The Way branch.
  • General Conditioning: A fourth-tier ability that gives the player more overall Stamina, which means better and faster sprinting and climbing skills.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: 9 Indie Games With Unique Mechanics That Deserve A Sequel
item.description:
Summary

  • Indie games offer unique mechanics and stories, creating impressive and personal experiences.
  • Celeste excels in platforming precision, story depth, and music, setting a high bar for potential sequels.
  • Katana ZERO's time manipulation mechanic and stylish combat set it apart, hinting at future narrative depths and character exploration.

For a long time, indie games have served as the inspiration for new ideas and unique game mechanics, as big studios often canâ€™t take such risks themselves. Often, these games impress players with their unique features or by breaking away from previously established game patterns. Some indie games get recognition worldwide, but many others prefer to serve their own quiet group of fans instead.

These games are united by their success in offering something thatâ€™s both impressive and unique to play. Itâ€™s clear from this list that the mechanical ideas these games bring to the table deserve more recognition and might suggest the need for a sequel that would raise the bar even higher.

1 Celeste

Platforming Precision Personified, A Deep Personal Hike

6 Images
6 Images
Celeste
10
9.0 /10
Released
January 25, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Extremely OK Games
Engine
microsoft xna
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC, Stadia, Steam
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Platforming experiences donâ€™t get better than Celeste due to its genuine story of growth and its responsive and perfectly executed controls. The game guides players while they lead Madeline up a dangerous mountain, and the path is further made difficult by her inner struggles. The bare-bones pixel art hasnâ€™t stopped the game from adding challenging levels that require skill and dedication. What makes it valuable is the way it mixes hard challenges with an emotional story.

In spite of how celebrated Celeste is, it is still unique by comparison. Since the development of " Earthblade " was delayed, what the indie platforming world lacks is another instant-classic game like Celeste . A second game could explore Madeline even further or present us with new characters having to overcome their own metaphorical hills, all while still using the gameâ€™s unique design. A continuation could delve deeper into themes of strength and finding oneself, interesting everyone, whether fans of the original or not.

2 Katana ZERO

Time-Bending Assassin's Tale

6 Images
6 Images
Katana ZERO
10.0 /10
Released
April 18, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Drugs and Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Askiisoft
Publisher(s)
Devolver Digital
Platform(s)
PC, Switch, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Katana ZERO places players in fast-paced action that requires great planning, as every enemy battle becomes a dangerous game of movements. What sets the game apart is the ability to control time, which allows players to attack and defend with great accuracy. Although not something innovative for the first time, Katana ZERO really sets it apart from the rest. With a gripping narrative that isnâ€™t told in order, the game looks at subjects like trauma and who we are, all while being engaging in both the game and its story.

While certain new free DLC is on the horizon, fans are hoping that the next installment will be a full sequel. New chapters might delve into the main characterâ€™s inner world, let him manipulate time differently, or introduce various new characters in the same setting. Because the game mixes excitement with a deep story, it prepares us to explore more and keeps us interested in new features and bigger story elements.

3 Furi

Rhythm and Reflex in Combat

Furi
Arcade
Shooter
Systems
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Violence, Strong Language

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
8 /10

Developer(s)
The Game Bakers
Publisher(s)
The Game Bakers
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Boss fights-only gameplay has never been better or more stylish. Players in Furi must face each boss as a new game or at least a whole new genre. Every encounter with a boss is special and demands players to change and notice small details. Vibrant visuals and an exciting synth soundtrack make the battles more intense and give players that much-needed boost to conquer the hard battle and come out victorious.

Even though fans eagerly want more, the developers are not working on a sequel right now. Still, thanks to its unique action and world, thereâ€™s a lot of room to improve and create new content. The next game in the series might introduce fresh battles, uncover secrets from the main characterâ€™s past, or look into parts of its world we havenâ€™t explored yet. Because the combat is based on skills, a subsequent entry can improve the system and add new challenges for everyone.

4 Sundered

Choices Between Humanity and Power

Sundered
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 76 /100 Critics Rec: 57%
Released
July 28, 2017
8 /10

Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4
Powered by

The game, Sundered , takes place in a beautifully haunting realm full of Lovecraftian monsters and always-changing caverns. Because the game uses both hand-made designs and procedurally generated level-changing algorithms, each experience is different. Players are tested to make decisions that determine their humanity, which can result in a variety of final conclusions.

Though the game was appreciated for how it looked and felt, there were those who didnâ€™t think it lived up to its possibilities. A follow-up can solve these problems by changing parts of the game, offering additional landscapes, and expanding the plot options. If the same universe continues, having characters or places we havenâ€™t visited could lift the storytelling and the experience of the game.

5 Dead Cells

Fluid Combat Meets Exploration

Dead Cells
8.3 /10
Released
August 7, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood and Gore, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Motion Twin
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The combination of fast action, many weapons, and castle rooms that shift each time made Dead Cells a standout in roguelikes. Because players can try out various builds, no two runs end up the same. Players are surrounded by mysterious adventures because of the impressive pixel art and fitting musical score.

After many years of adding new content, the developers have finished all plans for Dead Cells . Even so, there is potential within the gameâ€™s mechanics and the universe that hasnâ€™t been explored. The sequel may include new areas, challenges, and plotlines, looking into why the main character exists or explaining elements of the islandâ€™s story. A sequel could extend the original, adding new challenges and fresh stories for its fans to enjoy.

6 Baba Is You

Logic-Bending Creativity, Rules Made to Be Broken

Baba Is You
9.0 /10
Released
March 13, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Hempuli
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The game made players alter the rules by moving or changing the examples in its puzzles. With this feature, puzzles moved from being easy to quite challenging, pushing players to use uncommon ideas. A new edition might add additional complex settings and different challenges in learning and using words. Things like interacting with the environment, working on puzzles in 3D, or mixing existing rules, the possibilities could grow even more.

The concept introduced in the original would be built upon, while giving access to better narrative possibilities and world creation. Introducing more complex environments and spicing things up with some new types of linguistic challenges could be the path to a sequel. The unique features it provides canâ€™t be limited to just one entry in the series.

7 Sea of Stars

Sun and Moon Warriors Unite

Sea of Stars
9.0 /10
Released
August 29, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Sabotage
Publisher(s)
Sabotage
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Sea of Stars honors classic role-playing games, with both story-driven adventure and fight scenes that look impressive. Throughout the story, players guide two characters who make use of the moonâ€™s powers and those of the sun. The game's features involve hitting enemies with timing and defenses, which makes regular turn-based battles more strategic.

The game now features the free DLC, " Throes of the Watchmaker ," which broadens the storyline and points to more tales yet to come. The game is occasionally updated with content, but a sequel might add new information about the gameâ€™s lore, include fresh characters, and fine-tune how fighting works. Thanks to its previous success, another game could help make this popular RPG an even greater classic.

8 ANNO: Mutationem

A Beautiful Pixel Art World Where Cyberpunk Meets Action RPG

ANNO: Mutationem
RPG
Action
Systems
Released
January 10, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Developer(s)
ThinkingStars

ANNO: Mutationem sets players inside a cyberpunk world, combining sharp pixel art in a 3D world with some of the most gorgeous pixel art graphics. The game features Ann, who is an experienced fighter. Sheâ€™s on a quest to find her brother and piece together her missing past, all the while in style, fighting off dangerous enemies in lit-up cities. Its distinctive visuals and fun fighting draw attention to it among independent games.

New story parts, mini-games, and updates have been added, yet the universe in the game is still full of possibilities. A follow-up game might expand the answers to unsolved mysteries, take the story from another characterâ€™s point of view, or use its already existing multiple endings as a new plotline. Updating the fighting and adding to the storytelling could attract gamers who want to come back to this cyber world.

9 Signalis

Retro Survival Horror Reimagined

Signalis
9.3 /10
Released
October 27, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Microsoft Windows, Xbox Series X/S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Signalis shows that a strong story can be told using atmosphere, borrowing from famous survival horror games. Elster guides players through a grim world, giving rise to plenty of psychological and existential topics. Through its simple design and eerie music, the game ensures players are always uncomfortable, not because it surprises them with jump scares common in horror games, but instead by reimagining old classic mechanics in a new and updated fashion. The game features one of the most intriguing stories while also keeping players on the edge of their seats the whole time.

Unsolved stories and mysteries are found throughout the universe, even though the game has a self-contained story. A second game might introduce fresh stories and players, helping us understand better the game's themes about who we are and who we once were. If it follows its own style, another story would help solidify Signalis as a leader in modern indie horror by testing playersâ€™ minds and emotions again.
